text: During his time there, when Abraham told people about his wife Sarah, he said, “She's my sister.” So Abimelech,20:2. “Abimelech” means “my father is the king,” or “my father is Molech,” a Canaanite god. This may well have been a formal title rather than a personal name (see also 26:8). king of Gerar, sent for Sarah and took her to become one of his wives.20:2. “To become one of his wives”: supplied for clarity.
